Comment: Sometimes I think about how we got here. Roughly a football stadiums number of votes across three states on one night in 2016, fully opening Pandora's box to the absolute wildest, strangest and most disgusting cult-like adoration that I would have never thought possible a decade ago.   That night goes another way and you're looking at a 5-4 or 6-3 liberal Supreme Court majority, 12 consecutive years of Democratic executive power at minimum, and most importantly, a Republican Party that while would still be disagreeable on policy would not have descended into embarrassing themselves regularly on behalf of the literal Antichrist.   Like, 2017 was bad yeah, but because of him alone. The VP, the cabinet, shit even the Paul Ryan led House of Reps had somewhat maintained a level of sanity that is just completely absent from today's GOP.
Author: cpatkyanks24

Comment: This could be accurate. I feel like there would have been a wholesale rejection of Trump if he gets defeated in a presidential election by an extremely unpopular Democratic candidate after running the most racist, divisive campaign in modern history and three weeks after Pussygate was released. This would’ve been Republicans third consecutive general election loss. That’s a big deal, nobody likes losers.   Maybe you’re right, but I much prefer the timeline of winning in 2016 and cutting this thing off at the head than the one where we defeat him in 2020 because the thought that he was some kind of unbreakable messiah was by that point built into the psyche of 40% of the population and made his comeback even remotely possible.  We probably would’ve lost in 2020 after Covid to a generic Republican vs Clinton, but I believe (or would like to believe) it wouldn’t have been Trump.
